page.title: 05The Health Centre
page.content: At the Medical Centre which was built in 1969, there are{five doctors, called Dr Boyd, Dr Wood, Dr Greatrex, Dr Gamper and Dr Hickish. There are {four nurses, two Health Visitors, one {Chiropodist}and{six Receptionists.}The nurses bandage and give injections. Doctors diagnose their patients illnesses. Health Visitors look after the patients at home. Receptionists welcome patients. Chiropodists look after feet. There is one waiting room, two reception rooms, one treatment room shared between nurses and health visitors and two porter cabins. The nurses work in one of them. The other is used by the Red Cross. There is one common room. There are two loos one private and one public.
